articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Laotian Standing Vice PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Laotian Standing Vice PM
 Vientiane, August 10 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Somsavath Lengsavath, standing vice prime minister of Laos, who paid a courtesy call on him on Friday.
					 The standing vice prime minister said the friendly relations between Laos and the DPRK provided by former Laotian President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung were further developed by Choummaly Sayasone and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The friendly relations between the two countries are steadily developing under the deep care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he added.
					
					 He wished the Korean people bigger success in building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Gift from Lao President
articles.content:
Gift from Lao President
 Vientiane, August 10 (KCNA Correspondent) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Lao President Choummaly Sayasone.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to Laos, by the Lao president on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Vientiane
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Vientiane
 Vientiane, August 10 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, left Vientiane on Friday after wrapping up his official goodwill visit to Laos.
					 Leaving together with Kim were his suite members including Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kang Min Chol, minister of Mining Industry, and Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 They were seen off by Phongsavath Boupha, minister and secretary general of the Presidency, Sounthon Sayachak, vice-chairman of the Committee for External Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, the deputy mayor of the Vientiane City, Kiettisak Keobanhdith, Lao ambassador to the DPRK, and other officials concerned and Han Pong Ho, DPRK ambassador to Laos, and his embassy officials.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Lao President
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of thanks to Lao President Choummaly Sayasone on August 10, leaving the country after wrapping up his visit to it.
					 Kim in the message expressed deep thanks to the president, government and the people of Laos for warmly greeting him and his party and according them cordial hospitality.
					
					 Kim said that the two countries had an exchange of views on the issues of expanding and developing the long-standing traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries in several fields and boosting the solidarity and cooperation in the regional and international arena and matters of mutual concern, and reached a consensus of views on them.
					
					 He stressed that his visit to Laos offered a significant opportunity for deepening friendship and understanding between the two peoples and propelling the development of bilateral relations.
					
					 He was convinced that the traditional bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would as ever grow stronger as it had developed in the joint struggle for independence and socialism against imperialism.
					
					 Kim sincerely wished the fraternal Lao people greater success in their struggle to defend the revolutionary gains and consolidate the people's democratic system under the leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party led by the president. He also wished the Lao president good heath and happiness.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Mauritius President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Mauritius President
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a congratulatory message to Rajkeshwur Purryag upon the assumption of office as president of Mauritius.
					 The message wished the president success in his work for the country's stability and development, expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Chad
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Chad
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greeting to Idriss Deby Itno, president of the Republic of Chad and head of state, on the 52nd anniversary of its independence. 
					 Kim Yong Nam expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Chad will grow stronger, wishing the president and people of Chad great success in their work for national unity and economic development.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets Uganda's Acting FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets Uganda's Acting FM
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Okello Oryem, acting foreign minister of Uganda, on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries on August 1.
					 The message said:
					
					 The DPRK and Uganda have expanded and developed the friendly and cooperative relations in different fields for the past four decades since the two countries' establishment of diplomatic ties.
					
					 I am pleased with the fact that the Ugandan government and people are registering successes in their work for consolidating the country's peace and stability and achieving economic development.
					
					 I am convinced that the good bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would steadily grow.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Demands Conditions for Reunion of Separated Families
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Demands Conditions for Reunion of Separated Families
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society Thursday sent a notice to the president of Red Cross of south Korea clarifying its stand on the proposal made by the south side on Wednesday for a north-south working contact for discussing the issue of reunion of separated families and relatives. 
					 The notice recalled that the south side turned away its face from the DPRK's series of proposals for Red Cross talks and working contacts for solving humanitarian issues in the past, asserting that "they could not be separated from the political viewpoint". 
					
					 It is contradictory and nonsensical for the south side to propose reunions under the situation where the "May 24 step" is still in force to bar all travels of persons and cooperation between the north and the south and the road to Mt. Kumgang, the venue of reunion of separated families and relatives, is blocked, the notice said.
					
					 If the south side is willing to promote their reunion, though belatedly, it should lift the "May 24 step" and open the way for south Koreans to tour Mt. Kumgang so that conditions may be created for satisfactorily ensuring the reunion, to begin with. The notice urged the south side to clarify its stand on this matter.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Using Channel of Military Exchange for Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Using Channel of Military Exchange for Confrontation
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Brisk bilateral and multilateral military cooperation is under way in the international arena to defuse military tensions among countries and regions and promote stability.
					 But the south Korean Lee Myung Bak regime, the worst confrontation maniacs, is using even the channel of military exchange of good faith as a theatre for such confrontation as hurling mud at fellow countrymen and perpetrating new provocations.
					
					 A spokesperson for the Bureau of Military External Affairs of the Korean People's Army on Friday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the Lee regime's misbehavior:
					
					 Gangsters of the puppet military, yes men of traitor Lee Myung Bak, were reported recently to have held "dialogue on defense strategy" in neighboring country. 
					
					 At the dialogue they talked nonsense that the constant tensions on the Korean Peninsula were attributable to the DPRK's "military adventurism" and resultant "provocations".
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have courageously stood against the DPRK-targeted reckless war maneuvers and adventurous and hideous provocations of the U.S. and the south Korean regime of rat-like Lee Myung Bak. They, however, termed these just countermeasures "military adventurism" and "provocations."
					
					 This is an expression of their ignorance of the situation where peace and stability are preserved on the peninsula thanks to the DPRK's just counteractions.
					
					 These military gangsters even claim that the DPRK was to blame for the "cyber attack" which drove the whole of south Korea into extreme uneasiness and fear and caused the "paralysis of its tele-communication network" and "GPS disturbance."
					
					 This is just like trumpeting that the north was to blame for the sinking of the south Korean warship "Cheonan" and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident which was sparked by the south Korean side's wrong doing.
					
					 Not content with crying at home, those hoodlums visited their American masters and others whom they considered more helpful. Their behavior cannot be construed otherwise than a foolish attempt to make a noisier trumpeting outside.
					
					 This only brought to light once again the true colors of the Lee regime as lackeys steeped in sycophancy and submission.
					
					 Vociferating about confrontation with fellow countrymen after the "dialogue on defense strategy" was over, the Lee group floated such lie intended to mislead public opinion that the counterpart expressed "understanding" of what it asserted and "positively responded" to it. 
					
					 What is ridiculous is that the Lee group talked about "a decisive self-defense action," forgetful of its pitiful plight as colonial stooges. 
					
					 Great irony is that the Lee's regime is uttering such word as "self-defense action" as it requires an approval from the U.S. when it wants to use even a bullet or shell after being deprived of the operational control, a symbol of national dignity and sovereignty, by its U.S. master. 
					
					 We, availing ourselves of this opportunity, would like to state clearly as follows:
					
					 There is a Korean saying "a rabid dog makes a village unstable." 
					
					 Not content with bringing the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse, the group is making much fuss in a bid to turn the whole of Northeast Asia to theatres of confrontation and war as dictated by its master. 
					
					 That is why we had already declared at home and abroad that we would never deal with the Lee group of traitors. 
					
					 It is the nature of a rabid dog to bark more desperately and run amuck when it is backed by its master. 
					
					 The rat-like Lee group is that of rabid dogs as they unhesitatingly sold off the destiny of the country and the nation to please the U.S. master. 
					
					 Rabid dogs must be beaten to death instead of getting close to them. 
					
					 Whoever loves justice and hates injustice should heighten vigilance against all the sinister plots of the U.S. and its followers like the Lee group and bravely frustrate them. 
					
					 Herein lies a sure guarantee for defending genuine peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in its vicinity.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Japan Red Cross Societies Held in Beijing
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Japan Red Cross Societies Held in Beijing
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A press release was issued Friday on the talks held between the Red Cross societies of the DPRK and Japan.
					 According to it, the DPRK Red Cross Society and the Japan Red Cross Society held talks in Beijing, China on Thursday and Friday.
					
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were a delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Secretary General Ri Ho Rim and from the Japanese side a delegation of the Japan Red Cross Society led by Director of its International Department Osamu Tasaka.
					
					 The two sides had an in-depth dialogue on the issue of the remains of Japanese in the territory of the DPRK proposed by the Japanese side and deepened the mutual understanding from a humanitarian stand.
					
					 They also agreed to have more discussions on the issue in the future, and report issues raised at the talks to their governments.

articles.title: DPRK History Society Discloses Truth about "Yusin" Dictatorship
articles.content:
DPRK History Society Discloses Truth about "Yusin" Dictatorship
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The History Society of the DPRK released a memorandum Thursday disclosing the truth about May 16 military coup and the nature of fascist dictator Park Chung Hee who ruled south Korea for 18 years.
					 Unraveling the truth about the May 16 military coup, the memorandum said:
					
					 On May 16, 1961 an artillery battalion of the 6th army corps belonging to the field army command, the first air-borne unit and the marine brigade received an order to occupy Seoul. It was the prelude to the May 16 military coup which traitor Park Chung Hee, then deputy commander of the 2nd corps of the south Korean puppet army, pulled off with his clan.
					
					 The rebels occupied the army headquarters and seized "National Assembly" building, "Capital Building", city hall, public security bureau, Central Telegraphic Office and Pando Hotel which was temporary lodging of the "prime minister".
					
					 Not only Seoul but Taegu, Pusan, Kwangju and other major cities went under their control.
					
					 Park occupied Broadcasting Station, set it as the headquarters and announced that he took over the control of administration, legislation and jurisdiction.
					
					 He in the name of Army Chief of Staff Jang To Yong proclaimed "martial law" across south Korea.
					
					 The proclamation of the "martial law" led to the arrest of all the ministers of the Jang Myon regime, dissolution of "National Assembly" and local "national assemblies", ban on activities of political parties and social organizations, assemblies, strikes and travel, enforcement of nighttime curfew, pre-check of media, press and broadcasting, freezing of finance and sealing of airports and harbors.
					
					 Right after the coup, Park invoked evil laws to suppress political rivals and formed "Democratic Republican Party" in secrecy as part of his preparations to come to power.
					
					 On May 27 he became the "presidential candidate" from the "Democratic Republican Party" dominated by the coup forces.
					
					 On October 15 he became "president" in a fraud-tainted election amid terror-ridden atmosphere under the "martial law".
					
					 After seizing power, Park purged 70,000 dissidents and arrested even Jang To Yong whom he used for his purpose, charging him with hatching a plot against the coup.
					
					 The U.S. was behind the May 16 military coup all the time.
					
					 The then commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea provided south Korean troops in areas under his control to Park to be used for the coup. But when the clan of the Army Chief of Staff made a report about the coup to him, he issued a secret order not to interfere in it.
					
					 Dulles, the then director of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency, in his BBC appearance later confessed that the most successful overseas CIA operation during his office was the May 16 military coup.
					
					 This proves that the coup was not an unavoidable option but a planned one for the extortion of "power" by Park according to the U.S. scenario.
					
					 On October 17, 1972 Park proclaimed "martial law" across south Korea, disbanded "National Assembly" and suspended all political activities with the mobilization of tanks and armored vehicles. He then drew up the "Yusin Constitution" which made him "president", chairman of the Cabinet meeting, chairman of the National Security Council and chairman of the National Council for driving force for unification. This granted him unlimited rights including the rights to control all power means, revise "Constitution", take national referendum, effect "emergency measure", proclaim martial law and disband the "National Assembly".
					
					 He also set up the "lifelong presidential system".
					
					 Disclosing how south Korea turned into barren land devoid of right politics, democracy, civil rights and unbiased media under the "Yusin" dictatorship, the memorandum continued:
					
					 For 18 years since Park took power, at least 14 million innocent people were arrested and persecuted, 700,000 to 800,000 on an annual basis.
					
					 The whole of south Korea turned into a big prison and theatre of rowdyism.
					
					 Park declared "anti-communism" as the No. 1 state policy. He pledged his support for American master, calling for "building capabilities for coping with communism". He said that he would not unify Korea if it endangers the U.S. interests.
					
					 In a statement in June 1965, Park said his "supreme task is unification by prevailing over communism."
					
					 In the 1970s Park regime reluctantly came out for north-south dialogues and signed the July 4 joint statement the keynote of which is the three principles of national reunification. But ink was barely dry on the statement before he began to violate it.
					
					 Park worked hard to make "two Koreas" at the instigation of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 In June 1973 he released a "special statement", openly making public "two Korea" policy aimed at the permanent division of Korea.
					
					 Park sent the then minister of Foreign Affairs to the UN, imploring it to recognize "two Koreas".  He submitted "resolution on simultaneous entry of the south and north of Korea into the UN" to the 28th UN General Assembly with the help of the U.S. and run the whole gamut of trickery to secure approval votes.
					
					 When this came a cropper, the U.S. imperialists and Park regime made desperate efforts to ensure south Korea's separate entry into the UN at the 30th UN General Assembly in 1975.
					
					 The Park regime committed spying activities and armed provocation against the DPRK backed by the U.S.
					
					 From 1977 it built a concrete wall in the areas south of the Military Demarcation Line with the use of huge fund, labor and materials.
					
					 The wall severed 122 villages, 8 counties, 3 railways and more than 220 big or small roads and rivers and streams between the north and the south, to say nothing of mountains and flatland.
					
					 Park reduced the south Korean economy into a colonial economy, lame economy totally dependent on foreign capital.
					
					 He massively introduced foreign capital under the spurious signboards of "industrial modernization" and "economic development".
					
					 This allowed foreign capital to find its way to south Korea and plunder it unhindered with special privileges.
					
					 Foreign loans that were introduced to south Korea during Park's tenure of office reached 22.5 billion U.S. dollars while the direct foreign investment more than 1 billion U.S. dollars. They were used for squeezing the people to gain huge profits.
					
					 The introduction of foreign capital made south Korea's foreign debts reach 25 billion U.S. dollars in late 1979, 227 times increase from 1960.
					
					 Now south Korea faces huge deficits standing at 30 billion U.S. dollars in trade with Japan annually. This is attributable to its economy dependent on Japan which is blamed on Park who brought Japan's equipment and raw materials at random.
					
					 South Korea which was known as one of the world's granary is now forced to import 70 percent of cereals from abroad, a result of Park's policy of relying on foreign forces.
					
					 Big conglomerates became fat, resulting in deepened relations between the power and big businesses and wide-spread corruption and irregularities.
					
					 The gap between the rich and the poor became wider as never before.
					
					 Park's pro-conglomerate and low-salary policy helped the big businesses and reactionary government officials, who accounted only for 0.3 percent of the total south Korean population, hold approximately 60 percent of the national income. Toiling masses making up the 70 percent of the population, however, held only 15 percent of the national income.
					
					 Park's 18-year long rule sends shivers down to the spines of the people, the memorandum said, stressing that the revival of "Yusin" dictatorship should never be allowed.

articles.title: KCNA Report on Kim Jong Il's Journeys for Patriotic Devotion (4)
articles.content:
KCNA Report on Kim Jong Il's Journeys for Patriotic Devotion (4)
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- It is another great exploit of leader Kim Jong Il which will always shine along with the  Songun era that he laid a strong foundation of an economic power through ardent patriotic devotion. 
					 He always led the general advance, regarding a year as ten or hundred years with the belief that building a thriving nation was not empty talk but one to come true in the near future. 
					
					 He steered the Arduous March, taking a short and uncomfortable sleep and having rice-balls as his meal. He covered 353,576 km for his long journeys of forced march till the last moments of his life.   This is brilliantly recorded in the history of the country. 
					
					 During his journey for Songun leadership, he personally planted trees together with servicepersons and gave precious names such as "unit of patriots" and "persimmon-tree company" to those servicepersons who set examples in sprucing up the land of the country. This warm love shown by the peerlessly great man made the whole country pervade with patriotism. 
					
					 Let us live not merely for today but for tomorrow! This was his patriotic outlook on the life. This outlook was established throughout the country to kick off a drive for carving out happiness for all generations to come. 
					
					 Under the patriotic slogan "Let us spruce up our land and villages more beautifully!" a patriotic movement was launched across the country to spruce up provinces, cities and counties as befitting socialism and the number of villages of patriots has increased day by day. In the last decade there sprang up modern dwelling houses for more than hundreds of thousands of families to sing songs expressing thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Many famous mountains and scenic spots turned into people's pleasure grounds and witnesses of patriotism. Among them are unique mountaineering courses on Mt. Myohyang, the Ullim Falls and ponds to which people had no access and caverns which had been unknown to people for thousands of years. 
					
					 There is a popular song "The General Goes to Front While Children to Camps" singing of the warm love of Kim Jong Il. There appeared a lot of new university buildings including modern e-libraries and swimming pools and other talent-training centers. 
					
					 More than 233,800 paddy and non-paddy fields turned into 65,500 fields of standardized shapes and there appeared a new land covering more than 1,760 hectares in Kangwon Province in a matter of less than half a year. More than hundreds of thousands of hectares of land across the country have been realigned to befit the land of socialist Korea, a dramatic change. 
					
					 The national mobilization movement for improving the management of the land was waged as an all-people patriotic movement. As a result, recent years witnessed the planting of billions of trees and the building and improvement of roads extending tens of thousands of km and many rivers. From ancient times people said it was impossible to build any saltern on the east coast of Korea. But the Kwangmyongsong Saltern was built to be followed by Wonsan Saltern and Odaejin Youth Saltern on the east coast. 
					
					 A total of more than 10,000 km-long gravity-fed waterways were built across the country. Among them are Kaechon-Thaesong Lake Waterway, Paekma-Cholsan Waterway and Miru Plain Waterway. There appeared the Nyongwon Power Station, the Ryesong River Youth Power Station No. 1 and other hydropower stations. 
					
					 The Huichon Power Station is a great monumental structure in the era of Songun and the precious patriotic legacy bequeathed by Kim Jong Il to the country and its people. 
					
					 His words "Korea does what it is determined to do" instilled patriotism and intense loyalty into all service personnel and people of the country. As a result, a vast area of reclaimed tideland on the west coast turned into a large socialist farm. 
					
					 He said that satellites of the DPRK were put into space and sturgeons bred by experts of the DPRK went to the sea. Inspired by his words people in different parts of the country turned out in the drive to build modern stock farms including pig, chicken and fish farms on the basis of latest science and technology. 
					
					 People's ideals came true wherever he visited. There sprang up modern cultural and entertainment facilities including Majon Hotel, Kalma Theatre and Art Theatre in Hwanghae Province, and Mansudae Street, Changjon Street, scenery of socialism Poman-ri and Hwangjin Hot-spring village, Amusement Park of Kaeson Youth Park and the Meet and Fish Shop in Pothongmun Street. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il's life was totally dedicated to the people as proven by his words that his career is characterized by the word people. He made sure that the People's Theatre was built for the people, saying that a theatre going by the word people should be successfully built to hand it to posterity. The people are moved to tears when recalling that this was his last legacy bequeathed to the people. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il paved the way for the rapid development of knowledge-based socialist economy on the basis of the eternal foundation he laid for the industrial revolution in the new century. His life was, indeed, the life of the peerlessly great man which moves every Korean to tears. 
					
					 At a time when the country was in the most difficult period, he decided to spend precious funds for putting the national economy on a CNC basis, foreseeing the future of a prosperous country. It was a bold decision and the best choice, a product of his patriotic will to let the country proudly rank among advanced countries of the world. 
					
					 He watched the first CNC-based machine of Ryonha in April 1995 and visited many machine plants to boast Ryonha machines before the whole world. 
					
					 Everywhere he went, he instilled great will to look out over the world with one's feet planted on one's own land and the spirit of self-reliance of the nation into the scientists and technicians calling upon them to turn out in the drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology. He said that they should have the idea that one who remains a slave of technology is bound to be a traitor but if one masters technology, one becomes a patriot. 
					
					 It was in this unforgettable course that the DPRK's CNC technology led the world in it and kicked off the nationwide drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology. This put great spurs to the industrial revolution in the new century. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il pushed forward the industrial updating in all aspects and at the highest level, foreseeing the future. His ideas and policies have been implemented one by one in the crucible of the industrial revolution in the new century. 
					
					 He made the DPRK emerge a nuclear weapons state, a satellite producer and launcher and demonstrated the national power before the whole world with his noble patriotic signpost to make it look up to the great party and Kim Il Sung's Korea as his faith. 
					
					 His undying feats will always shine along with the history of the country.

articles.title: Sugar Shop Goes Operational in Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory
articles.content:
Sugar Shop Goes Operational in Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A new modern okdang sugar shop has been built at the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory.
					 The construction of the okdang production process further rounded off the material and technical foundation of the factory and laid groundwork for putting the production and management on a more scientific basis.
					
					 Its inaugural ceremony took place on Friday.
					
					 Present there were Mun Kyong Dok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Ri Mu Yong, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jo Yong Chol, minister of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry, officials concerned and employees of the factory.
					
					 An inaugural address was made to be followed by speeches.
					
					At the end of the inaugural ceremony the participants went round the shop.

articles.title: Performance of Opera "The Flower Girl" Given in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Performance of Opera "The Flower Girl" Given in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The performance group of the revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl" gave a performance at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Friday on its return home from China. 
					 Through the destiny of a poor family, the opera shows the truth of revolution and class struggle that tears and sympathy can not save the destiny of nation as well as that of one's family and oneself, and that struggle against the class enemy is the only way out.
					
					 The performance of the opera given before full houses in different parts of China showed the great vitality of the Juche-oriented arts that have greeted golden days under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and made contributions to developing the DPRK-China friendly relations. 
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, officials of literary and arts fields, creators, artistes and citizens in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK were invited to enjoy the performance. 
					
					 The opera demonstrated a perfect artistic standard through the organic combination of the performers' rich voices, graceful dance and peculiar stage decor.

articles.title: First Freight Train Leaves from Flood-hit Railway Station
articles.content:
First Freight Train Leaves from Flood-hit Railway Station
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kaechon-Joyang railway section in South Phyongan Province of the DPRK has been rehabilitated from flood damage in a short span of time, fully displaying the great army-people unity.
					 Servicepersons and people turned out as one in hearty response to an order issued by the Korean People's Army Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un and successfully rehabilitated Joyang Coal Mine Station and roadbeds and bridges in scores places in Kaechon-Joyang railway section in a matter of just over 50 hours after the rehabilitation drive started.
					
					 The first freight train loaded with coal left Joyang Coal Mine Station on Friday amid the warm send-off by thousands of service personnel and people.
					
					 The train departed from the railway terminal, sounding its whistle indicative of the single mind of the army and people.

articles.title: More Crimes of Japanese Imperialists Disclosed
articles.content:
More Crimes of Japanese Imperialists Disclosed
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- 35 materials disclosing crimes the Japanese imperialists perpetrated by imposing great misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean people in the past are added to the House of Class Education in Ryanggang Province. 
					 Among them are photos, newspaper clippings, materials and testimonies made by victims revealing the brutal atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists in the area of Ryanggang Province during their military occupation of Korea and their plunder of timber and underground resources from the province.
					
					 Articles dealing with "the incident in which they set fire on more than 80 houses" and "the incident in which they expelled more than a thousand fire-field farmers" and other cases were carried by Dong-A Ilbo at that time. They disclose the monstrous crimes perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists in a mountainous village in Pochon area. They brutally killed innocent people and reduced dwelling houses to ashes. 
					
					 There are also testimonies made by victims disclosing the fact that a lot of Koreans were forced to do slave labor and met miserable deaths at the construction site of the Ryonduphyong dam of Phungso at that time and materials on them. They clearly prove that the Japanese imperialists were, indeed, the most savage man-killers. 
					
					 Different exhibits and materials deal with facts that the Japanese imperialists cut a lot of trees in the area of Ryanggang Province and transported timber by use of rafts and railways and looted underground resources in different parts of the province, a clear indication of their aggressive and predatory nature.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Evading Blame for Terrorism
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Evading Blame for Terrorism
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Lee Myung Bak regime is claiming that the DPRK's assertion about its involvement in the recently attempted terrorism against the DPRK is groundless.  But truth about this is being brought to light with each passing day. 
					 Shortly ago, Kim Song Min, representative of the "Voice of Free North Korea " appeared at a press conference as what he called "witness".
					
					 He at the press conference let loose a spate of jargons as regards the time he met Jon Yong Chol only to play a tragicomedy admitting himself the fact that the attempted terrorism was carefully pushed forward under a scenario of the U.S. and its south Korean puppet regime.
					
					 Ri Su Bok who introduced Jon to Kim was found dead at his home.  
					
					 This undeniably proves the hypocrisy of their claim. It is a hackneyed method employed by the U.S. and the south Korean regime to destroy evidence by killing those concerned with the case in secret.
					
					 Even information available from south Korean media and conservative forces also gives the lie to the regime's claim.
					
					 Dong-A Ilbo on July 21 said that the "society for demolition of statues" has become a focus of public attention as far as the recently attempted terrorism is concerned.
					
					 It noted:
					
					 The society was formed with Kim Song Min as its head in October 2010.
					
					 Kim is a defector from the north and representative of the "Front for the Liberation of the North Korean People." 
					
					 It is known to have six branches according to areas of the north.
					
					These hooligans did not hide its existence on the basis of the conception that to let people know such society exists amounts to giving hope to north Koreans.
					
					 A defector from the north confessed that he worked out a plan to blow up a revolutionary site in the north, but he gave it up because of strict guard and the difficulty in smuggling explosives.
					
					 Chosun Ilbo on July 19 carried an article that there is an "Amnok River Fellowship Society" among anti-DPRK terrorist groups and the man surnamed Ma of the organization failed to carry out the operation to blow up a monument and statue in a revolutionary site in the north last year.
					
					 There are many more cases proving the truth behind the terrorism attempted by the rat-like Lee regime.
					
					 The regime is now bitterly censured and condemned not only by the people of the DPRK but the world people for attempting such gruesome terrorism in wanton breach of international law.
					
					 The story spread by the Lee group that it has nothing to do with the attempted terrorism and the terrorism was attempted by non-governmental organizations in a bid to mislead public opinion is nothing but sleight of hand to escape such criticism.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the group hide the above-said facts.
					
					 What merits particular attention are the remarks made by Yun Sang Hyon, legislator from the "Saenuri Party", who earned an ill-fame as a cur of the conservative group on February 13.
					
					 He said statues and other "idolization" facilities in revolutionary sites in the north are being blown up one after another, adding he cited information available from the south Korean intelligence service.
					
					 Being a chatterbox, this lawmaker divulged even the abortive operations, thus disclosing gangsters' secret terrorist operations. 
					
					 This means already at that time the Lee group opened to public that its terrorist operations were pushed forward under plans.
					
					 There is a lot of evidence proving that the U.S. was behind the recent incident.
					
					 Kim Yong Hwan, a renegade who was expelled from China recently, admitted, when interviewed by Kyunghyang Daily News on August 2, that the human scum and the anti-DPRK plot-breeding organizations are funded by U.S. Congress. He also admitted that such politically-motivated incidents were caused with U.S. political involvement as they were wirepulled and financed by it.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the ridiculous claim of the regime amounts to a height of shamelessness, only supporting the truth of the incident.
					
					 No matter what trick the U.S. and the Lee regime may play, they can never evade the responsibility for the recently attempted terrorism.

articles.title: Machine Exhibition Promotes Business Deals
articles.content:
Machine Exhibition Promotes Business Deals
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The 2012 Pyongyang Machine Equipment Exhibition ran at the Three Revolution Exhibition here on Aug. 6-9
					 The exhibition served as a significant occasion in furthering cooperation among countries and regions in machine industry.
					
					 Liao Jun, a manager of the Chee Siang Sewing Machine (Shanghai) Co., Ltd. in China, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am pleased at having closed trade deals with some businesses in the DPRK.
					
					 Many visitors paid deep attention to sewing machines presented by my company."
					
					 Tang Haiming, a manager of the company, said he could get a better understanding of the Koreans' likings through the exhibition.
					
					 Ken Quek Yew Chye, director of the Calpeda Asia Pacific Pte Ltd. in Singapore, said:
					
					 "Our company has come here with various kinds of pumps. I feel satisfied over having business with DPRK companies in this field.
					
					 My company will continue to attend the Pyongyang exhibition to invigorate trade activities with the DPRK."
					
					 Meanwhile, CNC lathes, mining machinery and metal cutting tools presented by the Ryonha Machinery Company and the General Machinery Trading Corporation of the DPRK attracted interest of foreign businessmen.
					
					 And a solar water heater manufactured by the Solar Equipment Development Center of the DPRK won a high appreciation at the exhibition.

articles.title: Participants in Pyongyang Machine Exhibition Praise DPRK
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Machine Exhibition Praise DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 2012 Pyongyang Machine Equipment Exhibition said they were deeply impressed by the Korean people leading a happy life. 
					 The manager of a company of Shandong, China said that all the Korean people are full of vigor. 
					
					 They have noble and high cultural attainments and are dressed neat. 
					
					 Pyongyang City is beautiful and clean. 
					
					 The manager of a Chinese machine industry company said that the DPRK preserves its peculiar characteristics. 
					
					 He said everything smacks of national flavor, adding that all these are associated with the devoted efforts of the Korean people. 
					
					 They are enjoying a worthwhile life under the socialist system, he added. 
					
					 The manager of a company from Dandong, China said that the policy for the people is in force in the DPRK and the people have become the master of the country. 
					
					 The working masses are fully guaranteed their rights in the DPRK. 
					
					 Everyone has access to job, medical treatment and learning. 
					
					 He said he was greatly amazed by the high cultural and moral level of the working people. 
					
					 The vice-manager of a company from Jiangsu Province, China after touring Changjon Street said that it is hard to believe that ordinary working people live in such wonderful apartment houses.
					
					 Every family in other countries is impossible to buy such modern houses with their earnings all their life, he said.
					
					 A member of an Italian company said after touring Changjon Street that it is surprising that so huge apartment buildings and catering facilities have been built in a matter of one year.
					
					 Only Korean people united around their leader in one mind can work such a miracle, the Italian said, expressing belief that the Korean people would enjoy bigger happiness.

articles.title: Anti-Japanese Resistance Forces Built in Japan Proper
articles.content:
Anti-Japanese Resistance Forces Built in Japan Proper
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- At the Xiaohaerbaling Meeting held on Aug. 10-11, Juche 29 (1940) during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, President Kim Il Sung advanced a new strategic task to make active preparations for Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					 In line with the task, preparations for the final battles to liberate Korea were stepped up on a full scale in the homeland, Manchuria and even in Japan.
					
					 With deep insight into the Japan-resident Koreans' movement, Kim Il Sung sent many political workers of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) to Japan proper. 
					
					 The political workers were tasked to build up the branch organizations of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF) and other anti-Japanese organizations of Koreans in Japan so that they could join in the KPRA's final operations.
					
					 They conducted in Kansai and other regions of Japan such activities as informing Koreans of the ten-point program of the ARF and the line on all-people resistance.
					
					 After all, many anti-Japanese student organizations came into being and legal or secret organizations were formed among Korean draftees in Japan. Typical of them was a special Korean youth society formed in 1944. 
					
					 Thus, anti-Japanese resistance forces were built in Japan, ready for joining in a nationwide armed uprising along with those in the homeland.

articles.title: Truth about US, S. Korean Abduction and Terrorism Disclosed (2)
articles.content:
Truth about US, S. Korean Abduction and Terrorism Disclosed (2)
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has long prodded the "National Foundation for Democracy" going under the veil of NGO into vicious allurement and abduction operations against citizens of the DPRK in areas close to its northern border.
					 The foundation, organized by CIA and financed by the federal government of the U.S., earned an ill-fame for bribing, luring and abducting  inhabitants of former East European socialist states at the end of the 1980s to let them join dissident forces for bringing down those countries. 
					
					 The foundation has carried on these operations, financing "The Citizens Alliance for Human Rights in the North", "Network for Democracy in the North", "Turi Hana" and other anti-DPRK conspiratorial organizations in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. provides at least 20 million U.S. dollars to those organizations every year.
					
					 The puppet regime does not conceal its premeditated and organized allurement and abduction operations, terming the acts of luring residents in areas near the northern border of the DPRK and taking them away to south Korea as "planned operations for making them defect to south Korea." 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime has so far spent 309.7 million U.S. dollars for the above-said operations.
					
					 Taking the lead in these operations are such anti-DPRK conspiratorial organizations as "The General Association of Christians of south Korea", "Turi Hana", "Kallilson Church", "Good Friends" and "Solidarity for Justice in the North," all going under the mask of religion.
					
					 More than 3,000 south Korean agents are active under the mask of missionaries in the Northeastern area of China including Yanji, Dandong, Shenyang and Tumen whose mission is to lure and abduct citizens of the DPRK.
					
					 Chon Ki Won disguised as a clergyman of the Missionary Society of "Turi Hana", confessed that he lured and abducted more than 900 citizens of the DPRK and took them away to south Korea from 1990 to 2009.
					
					 Wicked renegade Kim Yong Hwan, boss of an anti-DPRK conspiratorial organization, and other guys were arrested by the Chinese security authorities in March this year while conducting those operations.
					
					 Those guys trained DPRK residents abducted in the Northeastern area of China before infiltrating them into the DPRK. They attempted to commit terrorism and armed revolt at the instruction of the U.S. and puppet regime while scattering leaflets and gathering information, etc.
					
					 The south Korean regime assigned dealers, brokers, tourists and even south Korean students studying in China or in a third country tasks to lure and abduct residents of the DPRK. It pays them 3,000-10,000 U.S. dollars when they succeed in fulfilling the tasks.
					
					 When they find it hard to take DPRK citizens to south Korea, they bring them to a third country. Those who were brought to Thailand numbered more than 2,000 every year.
					
					 When agents of the U.S. and south Korea lure and abduct them, they employ such method as pressurizing all their families and relatives into "defecting to south Korea" in groups by holding them hostage. The number of those families abducted to south Korea by such method in 2010 accounted for more than 40 percent of the abductees.
					
					 Allurement and abduction operations are also prevalent under the signboard of "exchange of separated families through a third country."
					
					 The puppet regime brought "separated families" in south Korea to northern boarder areas to arrange the reunions with their kith and kin after finding them out through a secret channel. In this way the group abducts them.
					
					 In February this year, the south Korean "Ministry of Unification" revised the "guidelines for increasing the funds for supporting exchange of separated families through a third country" in a bid to drastically increase the funds for the above-said operation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Danger of US Oceanic Strategy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Danger of US Oceanic Strategy
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists' oceanic strategy is, in essence, aimed at gratifying their unlimited greed and ambition to dominate the Asia-Pacific region, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article.
					 The U.S. made public a fresh strategy for defense underlining the importance of its Asia-Pacific policy early this year, says the article, adding:
					
					 It was an open declaration of a scenario for focusing efforts on implementing its Asia-Pacific strategy and effecting its full involvement in the region.
					
					 Its objective can be explained by the strategic and geopolitical importance of the Asia-Pacific region, the greed for rich marine resources and the moves to control marine transport routes. 
					
					 The U.S. directs bigger efforts to the Korean Peninsula in carrying out its oceanic strategy.
					
					 Oceanic forces consider the peninsula as a springboard for advancing into the continent.
					
					 It is the U.S. world strategy in the new century to put Northeast Asia under its control and dominate the rest of the world. Given this fact, the peninsula is regarded as a major forward oceanic strategic base of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 It is a scenario of the U.S. to form a front for attacking the DPRK and other anti-imperialist independent countries in the waters linking Japan, south Korea, etc., and amass nuclear armed naval and air forces there in a bid to block straits, mount preemptive nuclear strike at these countries and carry out even landing operations against them.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to keep Japan and the south Korean puppet forces under its "security umbrella", set up a new mechanism for aggression in Southeast Asia and link it with the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance in order to establish NATO of Asian version for using it as a lever for carrying out its oceanic strategy.
					
					 The ulterior aim of the U.S. is to provoke a new war in the region.
					
					 Whether the U.S. strikes the DPRK or its neighboring states in line with its oceanic strategy for aggression, this will be bound to lead to a new global war, going beyond a local war.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Remarks of S. Korean "Saenuri Party" under Fire
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Remarks of S. Korean "Saenuri Party" under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Of late, vicious conservative politicians of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea made a string of anti-DPRK invectives, fanning up confrontation with the fellow countrymen in it.
					 Typical example is the extremely provocative remarks made by Kim Mun Su, governor of Kyonggi Province, over "the north's provocation." He called for "attacking the north tenfold or hundredfold" and even "striking its supreme leadership ".
					
					 "Presidential candidates" talked nonsense that "it is important for the north to opt for reforms", while taking issue with the "human rights" of the north.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This popularity contest and tiger hunting orchestrated by "presidential candidates" are aimed to gratify their political greed by currying favor with foreign forces and eliciting support from the conservative forces.
					
					 Their remarks are politically motivated provocation against the dignity and social system in the DPRK, an all-out challenge to it.
					
					 By nature Kim has been derided and ridiculed as "a man who does not know what to do and what not to do" and "guy seeking popularity by making unexpected remarks".
					
					 This is general public estimation of the "presidential candidates" from the party.
					
					 The remarks made by the "Saenuri Party" clan getting on the nerves of the north are motivated by the black-hearted intention to stay in power with the U.S. support.                                                                                                                                                        
					
					 It is an open secret that every "presidential election" in south Korea was backstage manipulated by the U.S. 
					
					 Explicitly speaking, it is an unshakable stance and will of the DPRK not to show any mercy to those who try to hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership.
					
					 Those who committed sins are bound to face severe punishment.
					
					 Now the "Saenuri Party" clan has gone reckless to seize power. The forthcoming "presidential election", however, will become its tomb.

articles.title: Japan's Apology for Sexual Slavery Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Apology for Sexual Slavery Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Young Electorates Federation of south Korea Thursday held a press conference in Seoul urging Japan to make apology and reparation for its past crime of sexual slavery.
					 The organization blamed the Japanese government for not showing any sign for formal apology and legitimate reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 It urged Japan, a war criminal state, to make formal apology for its crimes of sexual slavery and restore the rights of the victims.
					
					 The south Korean regime, too, should positively opt for settling the issue, it noted.

articles.title: Korean in Japan Condemns Projected War Drills of US and S. Korea
articles.content:
Korean in Japan Condemns Projected War Drills of US and S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans for Peaceful Reunification in Japan, released a statement on August 9 in denunciation of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers' projected reckless military drills to invade the DPRK.
					 Referring to the fact that they are going to stage Ulji Freedom Guardian on August 20, the statement said:
					
					 The projected drills will involve not only huge forces of the U.S. and south Korea but service members from those countries which had dispatched their troops to the last Korean War and even the offensive means deployed in the area along the Military Demarcation Line recently. This makes clear the fact that the projected saber-rattling will be an offensive to pressurize the north and all-out war maneuvers.
					
					 He urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to cancel the plan at once, admitting that with no rhetoric can they conceal their black-hearted intention.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Japan
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Japan
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A lecture took place in Tokyo on August 7 in the run-up to the 67th anniversary of Korea's liberation under the sponsorship of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					 Pak Han Sik, professor at Georgia University in the U.S., said in a lecture that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK poses a main problem in the DPRK-U.S. relations, urging the U.S. to immediately roll it back.
					
					 He called on the overseas Koreans to make positive efforts for the reunification of Korea.
					
					 A statement of the committee was adopted at the lecture.
					
					 The statement said: Japan has distorted and justified its history of aggression, made desperate efforts to grab Tok Islets and resorted to all sorts of discrimination and suppression of Koreans in Japan, far from making apology and reparation for imposing unspeakable misfortunes and disasters upon Koreans after occupying Korea for more than four decades. It is now stepping up the moves to launch overseas expansion along the road of reinvasion paved by the traitors in the 21st century worse than "the five traitors of 1905" and to turn itself into a military giant.
					
					 It is impossible to defend the nation's sovereignty and dignity and achieve prosperity as long as outsiders' aggression and the moves of the sycophants and traitors are allowed, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The U.S. should make a switchover in its hostile policy toward the DPRK, opt for concluding a peace treaty and pull its troops for aggression out of south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should step down after putting end to their sycophancy and treachery, confrontation with fellow countrymen and moves to stay in power.
					
					 Japan should apologize and redeem its crimes committed against the Korean nation in the past and halt discrimination and crackdown upon Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Koreans in Japan should solidarize and unite with all other Koreans in the south and the north and overseas, foil all sorts of anti-reunification forces' moves and wage an indomitable struggle for achieving national reunification by following the trend in the June 15 era.

articles.title: Koreans in China Study Kim Jong Un's Work
articles.content:
Koreans in China Study Kim Jong Un's Work 
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A study session on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" was held by the General Association of Koreans in China on August 4.
					 Present there were officials of the Association.
					
					 Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the Association, said Kim Jong Un comprehensively clarified Kim Jong Il's patriotism in his work.
					
					 She lauded Kim Jong Il as peerlessly patriot who ardently loved the country and people and performed undying feats to be eternally recorded in the history of the country as he devoted his whole life to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness.
					
					 She underscored the need for all the Koreans in China to deeply study the profound idea clarified in the work to learn Kim Jong Il's patriotism and become genuine patriots.
					
					 She also called on the officials of the Association and other Koreans in China to turn out as one in the drive for the prosperity of the country and its reunification, regarding it as the maxim of their life to love the country and the people.

articles.title: Round-table Talks of Koreans in China with War Veterans of CPV
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Machine Exhibition Praise DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China held round-table talks with members of the lecturers group of the war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) in Shenyang, China on August 5. The group had visited the DPRK.
					 Present there were Chairwoman Choe Un Pok and other officials of the Association and members of the group.
					
					 At the talks war veterans made speeches.
					
					 They said they were very pleased to meet Korean people with whom they fought in the same trench against the U.S. imperialist invaders, while touring the places of the DPRK associated with the blood shed by their comrades-in-arms.
					
					 They continued: 
					
					 We were amazed to see Pyongyang turned into a magnificent and modern city though not a single brick remained unbroken during the war. We saw for ourselves Korean people leading a happy life, benefited from compulsory education and free healthcare.
					
					 No force on earth can match the Korean people, united close behind their leader true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, they said, adding the DPRK has a rosy and bright future as they hold in high esteem the dear respected Kim Jong Un as their supreme leader and Marshal of the DPRK. 
					
					 Noting that peace today was achieved at the cost of lives of so many comrades-in-arms, he declared should invaders ignite another war against the DPRK, they would send their descendants to the Korean front to fully support the Korean people in their just struggle.
					
					 Chairwoman Choe Un Pok in her speech hoped the lecturers group would register big success in its work for DPRK-Sino friendship and the education of young people.

articles.title: Japanese Organization Formed
articles.content:
Japanese Organization Formed
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Fukushima Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism was formed on July 22.
					 Present at the inaugural ceremony were figures of the society for the study of Juche idea of Japan and other Japanese people, officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Korean residents in Japan.
					
					 Keizo Sumiya was elected as its chairman at the ceremony. 
					
					 It discussed the issue of intensifying the activities for the study and dissemination of great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in various parts of Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Swedish Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website of Swedish Organization
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association posted on its internet website on August 3 leader 
					Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					
					 The work, made public on August 4, 1997, clarifies the immortal exploits President Kim Il Sung performed for national reunification.
					
					 It formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification. It also indicates the tasks and ways for carrying out the cause of national reunification on the basis of the charters.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Reported by Chinese TV
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Reported by Chinese TV
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings Ltd., Hong Kong, China reported the main contents of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country."
					 This work, published on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of 
					
					Kim Jong Il's patriotism and leader Kim Jong Il's career characterized by ardent love for the country and its people.
					
					 It also clarifies important issues arising in effecting Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Hailed in Nigeria, Thailand
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Hailed in Nigeria, Thailand
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Personages of Nigeria and Thailand made public statements on August 1 and 3 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					 Abdullahi Muhammad Yamma, chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies, referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il formulated the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il dedicated themselves to national reunification, the greatest desire of the Koreans, all their life, the chairman said, adding:
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un made sure that the stand of national independence and the stand of giving priority to the nation were firmly preserved, regarding it as the most urgent task of the nation to achieve the reunification of the country, true to the noble intention of the preceding leaders.
					
					 The chairman held that the nation should neither allow any act of pursuing confrontation between compatriots as it drives the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe nor tolerate any act of hurting the dignity of the other side and inciting distrust and antagonism.
					
					 Chanai Longoen, chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association, said that the three principles of national reunification serve as guidelines to be always held fast to by the Korean people in their struggle for the country's reunification.
					
					 Extending full support to the Korean people in their nation-wide struggle for the country's reunification, the chairman stressed that Korea would be surely achieved under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Somsavath Lengsavath
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Somsavath Lengsavath
Vientiane, 10 de agosto (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se reunio el dia 9 con Somsavath Lengsavath, vicepremier permanente del gobierno de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, quien le realizo una visita de cortesia.
					En la ocasion, el vicepremier laosiano dijo que las relaciones de amistad entre Laos y Corea, preparadas por el Presidente Kaysone Phomvihane y el Presidente Kim Il Sung, se desarrollaron mas gracias al camarada Choummaly Sayasone y al Dirigente  Kim Jong Il.
					
					Refirio que bajo la profunda atencion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, se desarrollan cada dia mas esos vinculos bilaterales. 
					
					Deseo que el pueblo coreano obtenga mayores exitos en la construccion de Estado prospero socialista bajo la sabia orientacion del Maximo Dirigente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Vientiane
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam parte de Vientiane
Vientiane, 10 de agosto (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 10 de Vientiane al terminar su visita oficial y de amistad a Laos.
					Salieron junto con el el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Industria Extractiva Kang Min Chol, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung y otros acompanantes.
					
					Los visitantes coreanos fueron despedidas por el ministro y secretario general de la Presidencia, Phongsavath Boupha, el vicepresidente del Comite para las Relaciones Exteriores del Partido y vicecanciller Sounthon Sayachak, el subalcalde de Vientiane, el embajador laosiano en Corea Kiettisak Keobanhdith y otros relacionados, asi como el embajador Han Pong Ho y otros miembros de la embajada coreana en Laos.

articles.title: Presidente de la ACR envia respuesta a su par surcoreano
articles.content:
Presidente de la ACR envia respuesta a su par surcoreano
Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- En relacion con que el presidente de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea envio el dia 8 un aviso proponiendo el contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para discutir el tema del encuentro de familiares y parientes separados, el presidente de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea le remitio el dia 9 la respuesta para aclarar la posicion de la RPDC.
					Segun el texto de la respuesta, anteriormente, las autoridades surcoreanas vinieron dando espaldas a las reiteradas propuestas de la RPDC de sostener las conversaciones de la cruz roja y el contacto de trabajo para solucionar los problemas humanitarios pendientes entre ambas partes coreanas, aduciendo que "no se puede considerar esos asuntos separandolos del punto de vista politico".
					
					Resulta contradictorio y absurdo proponer el encuentro manteniendo las "medidas del 24 del mayo", que impiden el viaje reciproco del personal y la cooperacion de todo tipo entre el Norte y el Sur, y bloquean la ruta al monte Kumgang, sede de la cita entre familiares y parientes separados, asevera.
					
					Si la parte surena tiene la voluntad de promover desde ahora el encuentro de ese tipo, debe preparar las condiciones para facilitarlo anulando las "medidas" mencionadas y dejando abierto el camino turistico al monte Kumgang del personal surcoreano, y exponer claramente su posicion al respecto, concluye.

articles.title: Informacion sobre conversaciones de cruz roja RPDC-Japon
articles.content:
Informacion sobre conversaciones de cruz roja RPDC-Japon
Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo publicada el dia 10 la informacion sobre las conversaciones entre la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Japon. 
					Segun ella, las entidades de cruz roja de ambos paises sostuvieron conversaciones los dias 9 y 10 en Beijing de China.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion la delegacion de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la RPDC, encabezada por el secretario general Ri Ho Rim, y la de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Japon, presidida por el jefe del departamento internacional, Osamu Tasaka.
					
					Se realizo a solicitud de la parte japonesa un dialogo profundo sobre el problema de los restos mortales de los japoneses que se encuentran en la RPDC, y se profundizo el entendimiento reciproco desde la posicion humanitaria.
					
					Ambas entidades acordaron seguir consultando ese tema e informar a los respectivos gobiernos los problemas surgidos.

articles.title: AHC revela la trayectoria de dictadura de "renovacion"
articles.content:
AHC revela la trayectoria de dictadura de "renovacion"
Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- La Asociacion de Historiadores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (AHC) hizo publico el dia 9 un memorandum para dar a conocer la verdad del Golpe de Estado del 16 de Mayo en el Sur de Corea y la trayectoria de 18 anos de la dictadura fascista de Park Chung Hee.
					El documento revelo primero lo ocurrido realmente en el Golpe de Estado del 16 de Mayo ejecutado por Park Chung Hee.
					
					El 16 de mayo de 1961, el batallon de artilleria, la unidad no.1 aerotransportada, la brigada de marina, etc., del Cuerpo No.6, adscrito a la entonces Comandancia del titere Ejercito Surcoreano en Campana, recibieron la orden de movilizacion para ocupar a Seul. Esto fue el preludio del golpe que dieron el traidor Park, quien era subcomandante del Cuerpo No.2 del ejercito titere, y sus seguidores.
					
					Tras conquistar el cuartel general de fuerzas terrestres, las tropas rebeldes tomaron simultaneamente el edificio de la Asamblea Nacional, el capitolio, la municipalidad, el buro de seguridad publica, la Oficina Central Telegrafica, el Hotel Pando que fue residencia provisional del "primer ministro" y otros establecimientos.
					
					Cayeron tambien otras ciudades principales como Taegu, Pusan, Kwangju, etc.
					
					El traidor Park instalo la comandancia en la ocupada Estacion de Radio y publico que ha tomado totalmente el poder administrativo, el legislativo y el judicial.
					
					Ademas, decreto a nombre de Jang To Yong, jefe del Estado Mayor de las fuerzas terrestres, la "ley marcial de emergencia".
					
					Segun la ley marcial, fueron tomadas muchas medidas, entre otras, el arresto a todos los consejeros de Estado del "regimen" de Jang Myon, la disolucion de la "Asamblea Nacional" y las "asambleas" locales, la prohibicion de las actividades de partidos politicos y entidades sociales, mitines, huelgas y viajes, el toque de queda en horas nocturnas, la censura de prensa e imprenta, la congelacion de fondos, el bloqueo de los aeropuertos y puertos, etc.
					
					Inmediatamente despues del golpe de Estado, el traidor Park reprimio en virtud de leyes infames las actividades de sus rivales politicos, por una parte, y por la otra, impulso los preparativos para tomar el poder organizando en secreto el "Partido Democratico Republicano".
					
					El 27 de mayo, Park ha sido elegido candidato "presidencial" del citado Partido organizado principalmente con las figuras protagonicas del Golpe de Estado y el 15 de octubre, fue investido de "presidente" con fraudes e irregularidades y en medio del estado de emergencia.
					
					Luego de su llegada al poder, Park elimino a 70 mil opositores y arresto hasta a Jang To Yong, a quien utilizaba para sus objetivos, culpandole de la conspiracion contra los golpistas.
					
					El Golpe de Estado del 16 de Mayo fue ideado y controlado por EE.UU. detras de las cortinas.
					
					El entonces comandante de las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea entrego sin vacilacion alguna al traidor Park las fuerzas titeres surcoreanas bajo su mando para que diera el golpe y cuando recibio el parte del inicio del golpe, que le dieron los compinches de Jang To Yong, impartio a las tropas norteamericanas la orden secreta de que no intervinieran.
					
					Dulles, director de la Agencia Central de Inteligencia de EE.UU. (en aquel entonces), confeso luego a BBC que "el golpe de Estado del 16 de Mayo fue la operacion mas exitosa de la CIA en ultramar durante su mandato".
					
					Asi, el golpe del 16 de mayo no fue opcion inevitable sino el robo del "poder" a plena luz del dia ejecutado por el traidor Park segun el guion que le trazo EE.UU.
					
					El 17 de octubre de 1972, Park decreto en toda la extension surcoreana la "ley marcial de emergencia",  disolvio y suspendio toda forma de actividades politicas movilizando tanques y carros blindados. Y fabrico la "Constitucion de renovacion".
					
					En virtud de la "Constitucion de renovacion", el traidor se hizo "presidente", presidente del "consejo de gabinete", el "consejo de seguridad nacional" y del "consejo nacional de las fuerzas encargadas de unificacion". Ademas, tomo en su mano el poder ilimitado como el derecho de controlar todos los medios del poder, el de enmendar la "constitucion", el de convocar el referendum, el de tomar las "medidas emergentes", el de declarar la ley marcial, el de disolucion de la "Asamblea Nacional" y otros.
					
					Ademas, establecio el "sistema de presidente vitalicio".
					
					El memoradum revelo tambien que bajo el regimen dictatorial de "renovacion", el Sur de Corea se convirtio en la tierra estancada en la politica, la democracia, los derechos del pueblo y la prensa.
					
					Durante 18 anos del regimen de Park, 700 mil - 800 mil habitantes inocentes fueron encarcelados y asesinados como promedio anual y el numero de tales victimas se totaliza en mas de 14 millones.
					
					El declaro el "anticomunismo" como "primera politica estatal". Hablando de "adquirir la capacidad de enfrentarse al comunismo", juro a su amo gringo que "no unificaria el pais si eso afecta los intereses de EE.UU.".
					
					En su declaracion publicada en junio de 1965, chismeo que "nuestra tarea apremiante es la unificacion basada en la victoria sobre el comunismo".
					
					En la decada de 1970, la banda de Park, que salio a desganas a la mesa de dialogo intercoreano, firmo la Declaracion Conjunta del 4 de Julio fundamentada en los Tres Principios de la Reunificacion de la Patria y comenzo a hacerla papel mojado aun antes de que se secara la tinta de su firma.
					
					Tambien, a instigacion del imperialismo norteamericano, actuo freneticamente para fabricar "dos Coreas".
					
					En junio de 1973, publico la "declaracion especial" oficializando su politica de "dos Coreas" orientada a la division perpetua del pais.
					
					Ademas, envio al ministro de Relaciones Exteriores a la ONU para que solicitara el reconocimiento de "dos Coreas". En el 28o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU en 1973, presento con el apoyo de EE.UU. el "proyecto de resolucion sobre el ingreso simultaneo del Sur y el Norte de Corea en la ONU" y recurrio a todas las artimanas sucias para ganar los votos a favor.
					
					Cuando fracaso el intento de aprobar ese proyecto, EE.UU. y la camarilla de Park presentaron el proyecto de ingreso solitario del Sur de Corea a la ONU e hicieron todo lo posible por validarlo.
					
					Bajo la incitacion de EE.UU., el traidor Park cometio brutales acciones hostiles a la RPDC como el espionaje y la provocacion armada.
					
					Desde 1977, inicio en la zona surena de la linea de demarcacion militar la construccion de una muralla de hormigon armado malgastando enormes fondos, mano de obra y materiales.
					
					Esta muralla dividio 122 aldeas y 8 distritos y corto 3 lineas ferroviarias, mas de 220 carreteras anchas y estrechas y hasta los recursos fluviales que unian el Norte y el Sur.
					
					Park convirtio la economia surcoreana en la dependiente, colonial y desequilibrada bajo el control del capital extranjero.
					
					Bajo el rotulo enganoso de "modernizacion de industria" y el "desarrollo de economia", introdujo en gran medida el capital extranjero.
					
					Durante el mandato del traidor Park, el emprestito extranjero y la inversion directa de extranjeros introducidos en el Sur de Corea sobrepasaron 22 mil 500 millones de US$ y mil millones de US$, respectivamente.
					
					Como resultado, la deuda externa de la economia surcoreana crecio hasta finales de 1979 227 veces en comparacion de 1960 para ascender a 25 mil millones de US$.
					
					El Sur de Corea, famosa zona de produccion cerealista, se vio a obligado a importar del extranjero el 70 % de los cereales necesarios.
					
					Se enriquecieron cada vez mas los plutocratas, se estrecharon las relaciones entre estos  y el poder, asi como prosperaron los actos de corrupcion e irregularidades. 
					
					Debido a la politica para la plutocracia y el bajo salario a los obreros, los plutocratas y burocratas reaccionarios, que representaban a mediados de la decada de 1970 un 0.3 % de la poblacion surcoreana, se apoderaron de casi 60 % de los ingresos nacionales y las masas trabajadoras, que ocupaban el 70 % de la poblacion, se quedaron con el 15 % apenas.
					
					El mandato de 18 anos de Park fue el tiempo de pesadilla y no se puede permitir jamas el renacimiento de la dictadura de "renovacion".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia disparates del "Partido Saenuri"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia disparates del "Partido Saenuri"
Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- En estos dias, los politiqueros conservadores del "Partido Saenuri" del Sur de Corea estan fomentando el enfrentamiento fratricida con la RPDC.
					Al referirse a la supuesta "provocacion del Norte", el gobernador de la provincia de Kyonggi Kim Mun Su dijo que responderia con el "ataque diez o cien veces mas fuerte" y asestaria el "golpe a la Direccion Suprema" (de la RPDC).
					
					Los candidatos "presidenciales" calumniaron tambien a la RPDC hablando de la "actitud reformista del Norte" y su "problema de DDHH".
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual difundido este viernes, senala que esos chimes parten de la intencion de los que estan enfermos por el trono y quieren alcanzar su ambicion politica adulando a las fuerzas extranjeras y ganando el apoyo de las fuerzas conservadoras, y prosigue:
					
					Tal chismografia deviene una grave provocacion politica que calumnia la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC y un desafio frontal a ella.
					
					Al igual que los candidatos "presidenciales" del "Partido Saenuri", Kim Mun Su es criticado por los habitantes como "persona imprudente que quiere elevar su baja popularidad con palabras drasticas".
					
					Los disparates provocativos de la banda del "Partido Saenuri" persiguen el sucio intento de realizar la ambicion de retomar el poder con el apoyo de EE.UU.
					
					Es secreto ya descifrado que EE.UU. controla detras de las cortinas todas las "elecciones presidenciales" en el Sur de Corea.
					
					Como habia expuesto en terminos claros, la RPDC no perdonara jamas a cualquiera que trate de calumniar su maxima dignidad y regimen.
					
					Esto es la invariable posicion y firme voluntad de la RPDC.
					
					Las venideras "elecciones presidenciales" seran una sepultura para el "Partido Saenuri", sucia organizacion que busca el enfrentamiento fratricida.
